intro: Seseli denudatum, commonly known as the naked seseli, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central Asia and the Middle East. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white to yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its delicate appearance. Its flowers are usually arranged in compound umbels, a common feature among members of the carrot family. Seseli denudatum is often found in open grasslands and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
